messages.message: is it safe to archive the foundation repo (https://github.com/instabase/foundation) now ?

actually all of the following: https://github.com/instabase?q=&type=public&language=&sort=
any thing is still active other than blueprint-oss?
I think we can archive, but you must keep it public. I thought I already achived it in the past though

I think it is still referenced in our celery-app-tasks Dockerfile:

https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/distributed-tasks/celery/app-tasks/Dockerfile#L30

Is this safe to remove?

@lydia how did foundation dependency removal go in the platform? I know we couldn’t get rid of it in ib_intelligence, but what about app-tasks? is ib_intelligence the reason for it being in app-tasks?

Unfortunately, we were not able to remove the foundation dependency in the platform due to the potential of existing solutions breaking. We were looking into ways to put the foundation code inside the instabase repo in order to remove the need for an external repo, but that work got deprioritized. In the mean time though, we did remove ib_intelligence’s dependency on foundation, but I need to double check that we deployed a new version of that package with that change
